page.title: 10Farming In And Around Wragby
page.content: {MOOR FARM,WEST BARKWITH cont. { The main buildings at Moor Farm are the{house,}the{poultry sheds,}the {Dutch barn}(where the straw is stored),the{garage/workshop}and the old{original barns and stables. As the farmer cares for {conservation,the original hedges and {ponds are still there,}which is fairly unusual in Lincolnshire.Mr.Johnson is also going to plant out some trees behind his house. This year's sugar beet was planted on April 15th.It is the{old tradition that,by the day of the Lincolnshire Show,all the sugar beet in the rows should have their leaves touching.This has not happened in 1985.It has been cold and wet and the crops are 3 to 4 weeks behind.
